alert.note: Alert for Rogers (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 04 at 8:31AM CDT until May 07 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tulsa has issued a * Urban and Small Stream Flood Advisory for... Southwestern Rogers County in northeastern Oklahoma... Northwestern Wagoner County in northeastern Oklahoma... Tulsa County in northeastern Oklahoma... * Until 1030 AM CDT. * At 831 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding in the advisory area. 1 inch of rain has fallen. * Some locations that may experience flooding include... Tulsa... Broken Arrow... Sand Springs... Owasso... Bixby... Jenks... Coweta... Catoosa... Verdigris... Inola... Jenks Riverside Airport... Turley... Tulsa International Airport... Oneta... Gray... Additional rainfall of 1 inch is expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. This includes Interstate 44 between mile markers 217 and 244.
